<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Represents an allocation which has not been finalized yet.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// InFlightAllocs manage both executor memory allocations and working</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// memory allocations.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// On finalization, the InFlightAlloc should transfer the content of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// working memory into executor memory, apply memory protections, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// run any finalization functions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Working memory should be kept alive at least until one of the following</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// happens: (1) the InFlightAlloc instance is destroyed, (2) the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// InFlightAlloc is abandoned, (3) finalized target memory is destroyed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If abandon is called then working memory and executor memory should both</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be freed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/jitlinkmemorymanager/inflightalloc"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/jitlinkmemorymanager/inflightalloc">InFlightAlloc</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BasicLayout simplifies the implementation of JITLinkMemoryManagers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BasicLayout groups Sections into Segments based on their memory protection</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and deallocation policies. JITLinkMemoryManagers can construct a BasicLayout</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from a Graph, and then assign working memory and addresses to each of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Segments. These addreses will be mapped back onto the Graph blocks in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the apply method.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/basiclayout"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/basiclayout/#af3fa75b45aafa6c528042df53446d8e1">BasicLayout</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The Alignment, ContentSize and ZeroFillSize of each segment will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// pre-filled from the Graph. Clients must set the Addr and WorkingMem fields</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// prior to calling apply.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: The C++98 initializer is an attempt to work around compile failures</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// due to http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/cwg&#95;defects.html#1397.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We should be able to switch this back to member initialization once that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// issue is fixed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A utility class for making simple allocations using JITLinkMemoryManager.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SimpleSegementAlloc takes a mapping of AllocGroups to Segments and uses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this to create a LinkGraph with one Section (containing one Block) per</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Segment. Clients can obtain a pointer to the working memory and executor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="comment">/// address of that block using the Segment&#39;s AllocGroup. Once memory has been</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="comment">/// populated, clients can call finalize to finalize the memory.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note: Segments with MemLifetime::NoAlloc are not permitted, since they would</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="comment">/// not be useful, and their presence is likely to indicate a bug.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/simplesegmentalloc"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/simplesegmentalloc/#a42a424c4ae4bacccb54f2db883913ca5">SimpleSegmentAlloc</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/inprocessmemorymanager/#acea18d073433e3ab5a2e05383beee681"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/inprocessmemorymanager/#acea18d073433e3ab5a2e05383beee681">InProcessMemoryManager</a>(uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/implicitnullchecks-cpp/#a90146d35673da9e3e4a7f41f3b8c9b7e">PageSize</a>) : <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/implicitnullchecks-cpp/#a90146d35673da9e3e4a7f41f3b8c9b7e">PageSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/implicitnullchecks-cpp/#a90146d35673da9e3e4a7f41f3b8c9b7e">PageSize</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
